definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: lit. you cannot get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. learn to walk before you run
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 bu4 cheng2 pang4 zi5

sentences.english: In the second century Galen pinned it on a dryness of the tongue.
sentences.chinese: 二世纪时，盖伦将口吃归咎于舌头干燥。

sentences.english: She is always ragging Tom about his stammer.
sentences.chinese: 她总是拿汤姆的口吃开玩笑。

sentences.english: You must not tease a child because it stutters.
sentences.chinese: 你切不可因孩子口吃而嘲弄他。

sentences.english: Most stammers disappear of their own accord6) before adulthood.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人的口吃症状在成年之前就会自行消失。

sentences.english: I just can't take the advice that I shouldn't be worried about stammering.
sentences.chinese: 有人建议我不要担心口吃，但我就是听不进去。

sentences.english: The little girl speaks with a little stutter.
sentences.chinese: 那小女孩说话有点口吃。

sentences.english: He always stammered when he met her.
Stammering affects about 1% of all adults worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 口吃影响着全世界1%的成年人口。

sentences.english: Linnea still wages the battle against her stuttering and tics each and every day.
sentences.chinese: 琳内娅每天仍然要和她的口吃和抽搐战斗。

sentences.english: I always ask them to talk about how and why their stutter started.
sentences.chinese: 我经常询问他们成为口吃者的原因。

sentences.english: She labours under speech handicaps because she stammers.
sentences.chinese: 由于有口吃的毛病，她说话很费力。

sentences.english: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.
sentences.chinese: 性急者的心必明白知识，口吃者的舌头必说话清楚。

sentences.english: "For a stutterer or stammerer to be heard, that's a wonderful thing, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “对于一个口吃的人来说，这是件好事情，”他说。

sentences.english: I was a serious stutterer when I was in school as a child, as a high school student, and even into college.
sentences.chinese: 我从小学到高中甚至大学一直有很严重的口吃。

sentences.english: By much pains , the orator overcame a natural impediment in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 这位演说家用苦练的方法克服了天生的口吃毛病。

definition: readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
fat (e.g. pork fat)/fatty meat/(fig.) a gold mine/cash cow
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
